0.title: K'taka HC stays order to block Congress, Bharat Jodo Yatra Twitter handles
0.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Tuesday set aside a trial court's order to block the Indian National Congress (INC) and Bharat Jodo Yatra's Twitter handles over the alleged unauthorised use of music from the film 'KGF: Chapter 2'. The order is subject to Congress party "taking down the offending material" from social media before noon on Wednesday, the HC said.

1.title: 54-year-old woman dies after being run over by Vande Bharat Express in Gujarat
1.article_body: A 54-year-old woman died after being run over by Mumbai-bound Vande Bharat Express train near Anand Railway Station in Gujarat on Tuesday, Railway Police said. The victim, identified as Beatrice Archibald Peter, was crossing the track when the accident took place at 4.37 pm, an official said. The official added that the matter is under investigation.

2.title: Samantha will emerge victorious in her battle with myositis: Mukundan
2.article_body: Actor Unni Mukundan, who will feature in 'Yashoda' alongside Samantha Ruth Prabhu, has said that the actress will emerge victorious in her battle against myositis. "She is very hardworking and committed. She never spoke about her health or anything related to it and it comes as a shocker to me," he further added. Samantha revealed about myositis on Instagram.

3.title: Shot for song 'Chhori' when I was down with 102-degree fever: Nikki
3.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has revealed that she shot for her upcoming music video 'Chhori' when she was down with 102-degree fever. "But I kept going as I am very passionate when it comes to my work and my love for dance," she added. Nikki further said shooting for 'Chhori' was a memorable experience for her.

4.title: Probe launched after girl confined for over 7 years freed in Germany
4.article_body: German prosecutors have launched an investigation into the case of an eight-year-old girl who was allegedly kept locked in a room by her mother and grandparents for more than seven years. The girl reportedly showed no signs of abuse or malnourishment. However, she was "barely able to climb stairs on her own or navigate uneven ground".

5.title: 10-time MLA Mohansinh Rathava quits Congress ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
5.article_body: Mohansinh Rathava, a 10-time Congress MLA from Gujarat's Chhota Udaipur, has quit the party ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections. Rathava was reportedly upset over Congress' inaction regarding the elections and is likely to join BJP. He had earlier said that he will not be contesting the upcoming elections as "the youth should get chance to represent" Chhota Udaipur.

6.title: 'Kantara' is also my film: Yash after host mistakenly says it's his film
6.article_body: During an event, Yash was asked about the success of the Kannada film 'Kantara'. While asking the question, the host said, "As we speak, Kantara, your new film...not your film but a Kannada film is making waves." Reacting to this, Yash said, "Sir, 'Kantara' is also my film. You said it's not my film but it is my film also."

7.title: Ishaan says Mira Rajput is the 'most complaining' member of the family
7.article_body: Ishaan Khatter, on being asked about the most complaining member of his family, named Mira Rajput Kapoor, the wife of Shahid Kapoor. "She complains to me all the time. She's like 'you haven't picked up your shoes...you have come 10 minutes late or something', so in that way, in a cute way. Not in any other way," Ishaan added.

8.title: India's first-ever private rocket built by Hyderabad startup to launch next week
8.article_body: India's first privately-built rocket Vikram-S, made by Hyderabad-based space-tech startup Skyroot Aerospace, will be launched between November 12 and November 16, the company announced. The launch window has been notified by authorities and the final date will be decided based on weather conditions, Skyroot CEO Pawan Chandana said. The launch will take place from ISRO's launchpad at Sriharikota.

9.title: Sloth bear tranquillised after attacking 3 men in TN dies after release
9.article_body: A 10-year-old female sloth bear, that was tranquillised by Tamil Nadu Forest Department officials in the foothills of the Western Ghats in Tenkasi district after it attacked three men, died a day after it was released in the wild. According to the officials, the bear died due to a lung infection. The injured villagers are undergoing treatment, Tenkasi Collector said.

10.title: Why is today's lunar eclipse called a Beaver Blood Moon eclipse?
10.article_body: Tuesday's total lunar eclipse got its name from Algonquian languages once spoken by Native Americans in the New England territory. It coincided with what they called the 'Beaver Moon' – a moniker for the November full Moon. As Earth casts shadow completely on the Moon, it dims the Moon's colour, giving it a reddish hue, hence the term "Blood Moon".

11.title: Masai School raises $10 mn, Mithali Raj & Bhaichung Bhutia join as investors
11.article_body: Masai School, a Bengaluru-based jobtech startup, has secured $10 million in Series B funding led by Omidyar Network India. The round also saw participation from former India women's cricket captain Mithali Raj and ex-Indian men's football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia, as investors and partners. The funding will enable Masai to launch two new course categories, 'MasaiX.' and 'Scholar Program'.

12.title: Offender arrested in Hyd for sale of fake educational certificates
12.article_body: A habitual offender was arrested in Hyderabad on Tuesday for indulging in the sale of fake educational certificates. Muqtar Ahmed, who used to con people on various pretexts, was taken into custody under the Preventive Detention Act. He and his associates, Kaleemuddin and Mohammed Feroze, used to create fake certificates and sell them to customers for large amounts of money.

13.title: Nigerian arrested with banned drugs worth ₹10 lakh in Navi Mumbai
13.article_body: A 42-year-old Nigerian national was arrested in Navi Mumbai for allegedly possessing banned drugs worth ₹10.3 lakh. The arrest happened after the  Anti-Narcotics Cell (ANC) of the Navi Mumbai Police raided premises in Vashi last weekend and seized 130 gm of Methaqualone from the Nigerian man, officials said. A case was registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

14.title: Hyd's NIMS to hold interim selection for MHM course on November 17
14.article_body: The Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) in Hyderabad will hold a provisional selection of candidates for Masters in Hospital Management (MHM) course on November 17. Dean Dr N Bheerappa said the selection procedure is scheduled from 10 am onwards at the NIMS campus. Candidates whose names appear on the merit list should report with their certificates and hall ticket.

15.title: People I grew up with were cheering police: Guj man on being flogged
15.article_body: One of the Muslim men, who were tied to a pole and flogged allegedly by police personnel in Gujarat's Kheda last month, said, "People I grew up with watched and seemed to enjoy it as if it was entertainment." "They were cheering, laughing and chanting Jai Shri Ram while the policemen were humiliating us," the 48-year-old victim added.

16.title: Delhi students protest as funds not released for scholarship scheme
16.article_body: Beneficiaries under the Delhi government's coaching centre scholarship scheme protested outside the Department of SC/ST Welfare over non-payment of dues. The Jai Bhim Mukhyamantri Pratibha Vikas Yojana aims to train students from ST, SC, OBC and EWS categories for competitive exams. As funding for the scheme was not released, students said their monthly stipend of ₹2,500 was also withheld.

17.title: Dentist charged for throwing 4-yr-old daughter off B'luru building
17.article_body: Bengaluru Police filed a 193-page charge sheet against a dentist for allegedly throwing his four-year-old daughter off a building in August this year. According to reports, the accused was allegedly unhappy because of the medical condition of her daughter, due to which she had to sacrifice her professional life. She also tried leaving her daughter on an Orissa-bound train.

18.title: Delhi Capitals to release Shardul Thakur, four others ahead of IPL 2023: Reports
18.article_body: Delhi Capitals will release five players ahead of player retention deadline on November 15, PTI reported. The players include bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, wicketkeeper-batters KS Bharat and Tim Seifert, and batters Mandeep Singh and Ashwin Hebbar, PTI added. Thakur, who was bought by DC for ₹10.75 crore, took 15 wickets in IPL 2022 and had an economy rate of 9.79.

19.title: Who is Eugen Rochko, the coder who built Twitter rival Mastodon?
19.article_body: Eugen Rochko, the 29-year-old coder behind Twitter rival Mastodon, moved to Germany from Russia with his family when he was 11. He did B.Sc in computer science from a public university in Germany and launched Mastodon in 2016 when he was still studying. "The idea behind Mastodon is that online communication shouldn't be beholden to one private company," he says.

20.title: India is a very talented team, they will win T20 World Cup: ABD
20.article_body: Ex-South African skipper AB de Villiers said that India is a very talented team and they will win the ongoing T20 World Cup in Australia. "Everyone is playing well. Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli are in great form. Rohit Sharma hasn't had his best of runs, but he will come into the party when it matters the most," he said.

21.title: Our bowlers have been outstanding throughout T20 WC: Williamson
21.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said their bowlers have been outstanding throughout the T20 World Cup 2022. Ahead of the semifinal match against Pakistan, Williamson said that they will have to adjust to the given conditions. "[In] the first game...here (SCG), the wicket was a very good one...Then the second time we played here it had changed," he added.

22.title: He absolutely murdered me before I got him out: Moeen Ali on Suryakumar's T20I hundred
22.article_body: Recalling Suryakumar Yadav's 117(55) against England, all-rounder Moeen Ali said, "He absolutely murdered me before I got him out." "He played amazingly well, some of the shots he played were some of the best I have ever seen," Ali added. "Thankfully, he was tired when I got him out...that's how I got him, I think," he stated.

23.title: Ex-serviceman kidnapped from Delhi, family gets 'sar tan se juda' threat
23.article_body: An ex-serviceman was kidnapped from Delhi's Sultanpuri area on Monday. After the victim, Rajendra Prasad, didn't return from work on Monday, his family tried calling him but the calls were disconnected several times. Prasad's family later received a message with a logo of Popular Front of India saying, "Sar tan se juda (head will be severed) in Ajmer via Pakistan."

24.title: It will happen soon: Arbaaz on film with brothers Salman and Sohail
24.article_body: Arbaaz Khan, when asked if he is planning to collaborate with brothers Salman Khan and Sohail Khan on a film, said, "There's a big possibility of that." "Right now, we're all engaged in our own things. But there will be a time when...[we'll] come together for something. And that might not be too late. It'll be quite soon," he added.

25.title: DU receives 1,000 applications for mid-entry window
25.article_body: The Delhi University (DU) has received over 1,000 applications in its mid-entry window to the varsity through the Common Seat Allocation System. Through the mid-entry window, candidates, who failed to apply before, get another chance to apply. The window was open from November 5 to 7. In total, DU offered around 70,000 undergraduate seats for admission this year.

26.title: AIMIM seeks permission to celebrate Tipu Jayanti at Idgah Maidan
26.article_body: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) and some Dalit organisations have sought permission from the municipal corporation to celebrate Tipu Jayanti at the Idgah Maidan in Karnataka's Hubballi. Meanwhile, Sri Ram Sena has also submitted a memorandum seeking permission to celebrate Kanakadasa Jayanti there. Earlier, the state high court allowed Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations at the ground.

27.title: Stray dog gets stuck on middle of B'luru Metro track, rescued
27.article_body: A stray dog, which was stuck on a Bengaluru Metro track, was immediately rescued by an animal rescue team. The electricity on the track was turned off immediately and the engineering team of Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) was alerted soon after a Twitter user complained of the dog being stuck.

28.title: US aid worker shot dead in Baghdad: Iraqi officials
28.article_body: A US aid worker living in Baghdad was purportedly shot dead in the Iraqi capital on Monday, as per two police officials. The man was driving with his wife and child when a car cut him off and assailants in another car opened fire on him, the officials said. The motive behind the killing was not immediately clear, they added.

29.title: US hopes India will benefit from Russian oil price cap: US Treasury Secy
29.article_body: India will "benefit" from the proposed price cap on Russian oil, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said ahead of her visit to India this week. "Our hope would be that India would take advantage of this price cap, though its firms are bargaining with Russia," Yellen said. "We want to make sure...Russia doesn't profit unduly from the war," Yellen added.

30.title: DeFi startup Flint moves out funds from crypto exchange FTX
30.article_body: Sequoia-backed decentralised finance startup Flint has "moved out" its funds from cryptocurrency exchange FTX. Bengaluru-based Flint told its users, "Given the situation with FTX...we want to ensure that your fund is safe and in order to do that, we have moved out all our funds from FTX safely." Flint allows users to earn up to 13% annually on deposited funds.

31.title: 62-year-old woman dies after falling into open manhole in Virar
31.article_body: A 62-year-old woman died after she accidentally fell into an open manhole in Virar, Maharashtra on Monday. The deceased, Kamlaben Shah, left her house to go to a local temple but didn't return and her body was found in the evening. A teenager informed of seeing a hand coming out of the water of the manhole, Kamlaben's husband Gulabchand said.

32.title: Ready to be hanged if my allegations are proved wrong: Conman Sukesh to Kejriwal
32.article_body: After alleging he gave money to AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in exchange for a Rajya Sabha seat, conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar made new allegations. He said AAP's Satyendar Jain asked for money for the party during Punjab and Goa polls. "Kejriwal Ji, if any of my raised issues...turn out to be wrong...I'm ready to be hanged," he added.

33.title: Zoho crosses $1 bn in revenue, to double investments in AI
33.article_body: Chennai-based software-as-a-service (SaaS) firm Zoho announced that it has crossed $1 billion in revenue with India leading the growth and the regional annual revenue increasing by 77% in 2021. "No one has built a billion-dollar product company in India," CEO and Co-Founder Sridhar Vembu said. Zoho also announced that it will double investment into technologies like blockchain and AI.

34.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan participate in US-mediated peace talks
34.article_body: The foreign ministers of Azerbaijan and Armenia have met in Washington to participate in US-mediated peace talks, a week after Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted a similar summit. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, "The United States is committed to the peace negotiations." Armenia and Azerbaijan have fought two wars (1991 and 2020) over the territory of Nagorno-Karabakh.

35.title: 7 arrested in China as residents resist COVID-19 restrictions
35.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in northeastern China after residents clashed with the police over enforcing strict COVID-19 restrictions. The arrests come as China records new COVID-19 cases daily, with Guangzhou city reporting 2,230 cases on Tuesday. China has maintained a "zero-COVID" policy, according to which quarantines, lockdowns and near-daily tests are compulsory.

36.title: Seems unwarranted: KTR on Hyderabad's Nizam College hostel issue
36.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) on Tuesday took to Twitter to address the issue of non-allotment of rooms to undergraduate students of Hyderabad's Nizam College in the new girls' hostel on the campus. "This situation seems unwarranted," he tweeted. He added, "[I] request [state Education Minister Sabitha Indra Reddy] to kindly intervene and address the issue."

37.title: Death anniversary of Indian economy: Congress on demonetisation
37.article_body: Taking a jibe at the Centre on the sixth anniversary of demonetisation, Congress on Tuesday called it "the death anniversary of the Indian economy". Congress leader Gourav Vallabh called demonetisation "independent India's greatest organised loot", adding that he wants PM Narendra Modi to tell the nation if he considers the move as his epic failure.

38.title: BJP planned Sena leader Sudhir Suri's murder to defame AAP: MP
38.article_body: Sangrur MP Simranjit Singh Mann has claimed that BJP and RSS planned Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri's murder to defame AAP. He said that BJP did this to gain sympathy votes, adding that BJP's plan was to defame AAP ahead of the Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. A Sikh named Sandeep Singh has been accused of killing Suri.

39.title: TV host Whoopi Goldberg quits Twitter after Musk's takeover, calls it 'too messy'
39.article_body: American TV host Caryn Elaine Johnson, known professionally as Whoopi Goldberg, quit Twitter after it was bought by Elon Musk. "It's been a little over a week since Elon Musk took over Twitter and this place is too messy," she said. "I'm tired of now having certain kinds of attitudes blocked now getting back on," she added.

40.title: Feared my character in 'Four More...' would be hated: Maanvi Gagroo
40.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo said her character Siddhi was the most loved character after season two of her show 'Four More Shots Please!' Maanvi said she didn't agree with Siddhi being "annoying and erratic" after her father's death. "I feared...now, she would be hated. While shooting, I hated her...the makers made me believe...it'll all come together in the end," she added.

41.title: China playing 'aggressive games': Trudeau on poll interference claim
41.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Monday accused China of playing "aggressive games" with democracies and targeting Canadian institutions. This came following a report by Global News that claimed Beijing had funded a "clandestine network" of at least 11 candidates in the 2019 Canadian federal elections. Responding to the allegations, China said that it has "no interest" in Canada's internal affairs.

42.title: Incredible lie: Greek PM on report claiming he wiretapped ministers
42.article_body: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis on Monday termed a report by left-wing newspaper Documento about him wiretapping his own ministers as an "incredible lie". He said the report lacked "the faintest proof" against him. The said report claimed that more than 30 individuals, including ministers and business people, had been under state surveillance via Israeli spyware, Predator.

43.title: SRK, Salman, Hrithik to be part of Aditya Chopra's spy universe: Report
43.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan and Hrithik Roshan will reportedly be cast in a film together as a part of producer Aditya Chopra's spy universe. "The paths of SRK's character from 'Pathaan', Salman's character from 'Tiger' franchise and Hrithik's character from 'War' will constantly cross to build up the grand finale of the spy universe," a source added.

44.title: PM Modi unveils logo, theme and website of India's G20 presidency
44.article_body: PM Narendra Modi unveiled the logo, theme and website for India's presidency of the G20. The logo, created with the four colours of India's national flag, shows the earth sitting atop a lotus, and the seven petals in the logo signify the coming together of seven continents at G20. The theme is 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam: One Earth, One Family, One Future'.

45.title: Car stunt by drunk men at 2 am kills 50-year-old in Gurugram, video surfaces
45.article_body: A 50-year-old man was killed after drunk men hit him with their SUV while performing stunts in Gurugram, the police said. Videos of the incident, which took place at around 2 am on Sunday, show the men drifting their car in an area outside a liquor shop. "Seven accused have been arrested and two cars have been impounded," said police.

46.title: It worked in our favour, we'll keep it going: Jaishankar on Russian oil import amid war
46.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said in Moscow that India-Russia relations have 'worked in India's favour' by facilitating oil imports. "If it works to my advantage, I would like to keep that going," said Jaishankar. "As the world's third-largest consumer of oil and gas, it is our fundamental obligation to ensure Indian consumers have the best possible access," he added.

47.title: A character that changed everything for me: Yami on 3 yrs of 'Bala'
47.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a post marking three years of 'Bala'. "Looking back with a heart full of love and gratitude for the film and Pari Mishra! A character that changed everything for me ever since," she wrote. Directed by Amar Kaushik, the comedy film also featured Ayushmann Khurrana and Bhumi Pednekar.

48.title: Will construct ropeways, cable railway system in Himachal: Nitin Gadkari
48.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari promised to make more ropeways, cable railway system and tunnels in the state. "Constructing roads is difficult here…if we can connect these mountains through the electric transport system, [this] will ease...travel and improve connectivity," said Gadkari. The state will go to polls on November 12.

49.title: First teaser poster of Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2' to be out soon: Report
49.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun has reportedly shot for the teaser poster of 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2', which the makers are planning to release by the end of November. Reportedly, Allu Arjun will fly to Bangkok to shoot the film's first schedule. As per a report, during the 15-day long schedule, the actor will be shooting some fight sequences.

50.title: Nana Patekar to play lawyer in debut web series 'Laal Batti': Reports
50.article_body: Nana Patekar is set to make his web series debut with a show titled 'Laal Batti', as per reports. He'll reportedly play the role of a lawyer in the show, which will be directed by Prakash Jha. Meghna Malik, known for shows like 'Na Aana Iss Des Laado' and 'Bandish Bandits', has reportedly been roped in to play his wife.

51.title: India advises return to dialogue, diplomacy: Jaishankar in Russia amid Ukraine war
51.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday commented on the Ukraine war during a press conference with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and said, "India strongly advocates a return to dialogue and diplomacy." He said the consequences of the war are visible. "The global economy is...too interdependent for significant conflict anywhere not to have major [impacts] elsewhere," he added.

52.title: Varun Dhawan's 'Bhediya' to premiere at IFFI Goa
52.article_body: Varun Dhawan's 'Bhediya' will premiere at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI), which is to be held in Goa from November 20-28. As per a source, Varun, along with Kriti Sanon, Abhishek Banerjee and director Amar Kaushik, will attend the event. Apart from 'Bhediya', 'The Storyteller' and 'India Lockdown' will also premiere at the festival.

53.title: Rahul should apologise: MP Minister on Cong leader's 'Hindu' remark
53.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday demanded an apology from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu'. "Rahul Gandhi should apologise for the derogatory remarks...I will write a letter to him to clarify what Congress thinks about 'Hindu' and 'Hindutva'," Mishra added.

54.title: Help free Indian sailors held in Equatorial Guinea: Kerala CM to PM
54.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday sought PM Narendra Modi's intervention to facilitate the release of 16 Indian sailors, including three from Kerala, held hostage in Equatorial Guinea. Vijayan, in his letter, said that the crew of the ship did not engage in any unlawful activities and a further delay in bringing them back would make their lives unsafe.

55.title: 'RRR' beats '3 Idiots' to become 3rd highest-grossing Indian film in Japan
55.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' has beaten Aamir Khan's '3 Idiots' to become the third highest-grossing Indian film in Japan. 'RRR' collected around ¥180 million (₹10 crore) in the country. The film is now behind Rajamouli's Baahubali 2: The Conclusion, which collected ¥300 million (₹16.75 crore), and Rajinikanth's 1995 film 'Muthu', which collected ¥400 million (₹22 crore).

56.title: Will do everything to ensure Chhawla rape victim gets justice: U'khand CM
56.article_body: After the SC acquitted the three accused in the 2012 Chhawla rape case, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami assured that the 19-year-old victim, who was raped and killed, would get justice. "I have spoken to [the] advocate...and Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju…The victim is the daughter of our country...we will do everything to ensure that she gets justice," said Dhami.

57.title: Territorial integrity a key condition to resume talks with Russia: Ukraine
57.article_body: Ukraine's National Security and Defence Council Secretary Oleksiy Danilov has said that the main condition for resumption of negotiations with Russia is restoration of Ukraine's territorial integrity. On Monday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he was open to only "genuine" negotiations that would restore Ukraine's borders.

58.title: Jubilant Foodworks Q2 net profit rises by 9.8% to ₹131.5 crore
58.article_body: Jubilant Foodworks, which operates Domino's Pizza and Dunkin' Donuts in India, posted a 9.8% rise in net profit at ₹131.5 crore for the September quarter as against ₹119.8 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The company's revenue from operations rose by 16.6% to ₹1,301.5 crore as compared to ₹1,116.2 crore in the year-ago period.

59.title: K'taka Cong to approach HC against order to block Twitter handles
59.article_body: Karnataka Congress will file a writ petition in the Karnataka High Court seeking to quash an order by a lower court directing Twitter to temporarily block the accounts of the Congress party and Bharat Jodo Yatra over alleged illegal use of sound records of 'KGF: Chapter 2' movie. Earlier, Congress said it hadn't received a copy of the order.

60.title: Sudha Murthy touches feet of Hindutva activist Sambhaji Bhide; video surfaces
60.article_body: Philanthropist Sudha Murthy, the wife of Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy, met Hindutva activist Sambhaji Bhide during an event in Maharashtra's Sangli and touched his feet to take his blessings. Bhide, a key accused in the Bhima Koregaon violence case, was dropped from the case after no evidence was found against him. A former RSS activist, Bhide founded Shiv Pratishthan Hindustan.

61.title: Drugs were f**king delicious, almost died in 2007 of overdose: Eminem
61.article_body: Talking about his struggles with addiction, rapper Eminem shared that he "almost died from an overdose in 2007". "Because drugs were f**king delicious...I had to go and f**k it all up and take too many," he said. Stating that music saved his life, Eminem remembered how he had to fight his way through to try and breakthrough in music.

62.title: This is anti-national: K'taka CM over Cong leader's 'Hindu' remark
62.article_body: Following Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said this is anti-national and everyone should condemn it. "Is Rahul Gandhi and Siddaramaiah's silence endorsing Satish's statements?" CM Bommai asked. "They make statements with half knowledge to appease voters of one community and dream to get minority votes," he stated.

63.title: Ukraine receives first delivery of NASAMS air defence systems
63.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov has said that Ukraine received its first NASAMS and Aspide air defence systems. Reznikov thanked US, Spain and Norway, saying that Ukraine will continue to shoot down enemy targets. Last week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged G7 leaders to provide more help with air defence amid Russia's attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure.

64.title: Senior Congress leader KK Pandey dies during Rahul's Bharat Jodo Yatra
64.article_body: Senior Congress leader and general secretary of Congress Seva Dal, Krishna Kumar Pandey, died on Tuesday during Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra's Nanded. "He was walking along with me and Digvijaya Singh carrying the Tricolour. He handed over the flag to another person and about 15 minutes later he...suffered a heart attack," Congress' Jairam Ramesh said.

65.title: EAM Jaishankar meets Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Russia
65.article_body: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov held a meeting in Russia's Moscow today. "I believe this is the fifth time we're meeting this year and that speaks of long-term partnership and the importance we attach to each other. I'm really glad to be here...today to carry forward this dialogue," the EAM said in Moscow.

66.title: Chiratae Ventures raises $100 mn in 1st close of maiden growth fund
66.article_body: Chiratae Ventures, a venture capital firm that invests in early-stage startups, has secured $100 million in the first close of its maiden growth fund. It raised funds from investors including Kris Gopalakrishnan's family office, SBI and IIFL Wealth Management. Chiratae Ventures, founded in 2006, backed unicorns like Lenskart, cure.fit and Flipkart among others.

67.title: 73 infiltration bids reported in J&K in 2021, lowest in 5 yrs: Govt
67.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has revealed that 73 infiltration attempts from Pakistan were reported in 2021, the lowest in five years. "In 2017, as many as 419 infiltration attempts were reported. The number stood at 328 in 2018, 216 in 2019 and 99 in 2020," MHA said. It also added that militancy in J&K is directly linked with infiltration.

68.title: Policybazaar to face ₹560 crore of ESOP expenses in FY23
68.article_body: Insurance aggregator platform Policybazaar will face ₹560 crore of employee stock option (ESOP) expenses in FY23, the company said during an earnings call. The company added that the cost of ESOPs granted in October last year will reduce gradually over the next few years. Policybazaar granted ESOPs worth ₹1,044 crore to three top executives in FY22.

69.title: England will beat India in T20 WC 2022 semi-final: Kevin Pietersen
69.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen said he "really" thinks that England will beat India in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between the two sides on November 10 (Thursday). "There is a very good chance [that]...England [will take on] Pakistan [in the final]," added Pietersen. "I just need Virat Kohli to have a day off," he stated.

70.title: Renault, Google expand partnership to build 'software defined vehicle'
70.article_body: Renault and Google said on Tuesday that they are expanding their partnership in software services for future Renault vehicles. The "software-defined vehicle" will be built on Google's Android Automotive operating system and will send data to the company's cloud servers for processing. Google will become the preferred cloud supplier to the French automaker, the companies added.

71.title: Kerala Governor has lost his mental stability: CPI(M) state secretary
71.article_body: The CPI(M) on Tuesday distributed leaflets criticising Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan and pointed fingers at his mental stability. CPI(M) state secretary MV Govindan said, "He (the Governor) has lost his mental stability. On November 15, we will stage a never seen before  [demonstration] when one lakh people will protest [outside] the official residence of the Governor."

72.title: UP man keeps stolen ₹18 lakh in drum at home, says got idea from Dhol movie
72.article_body: A man from Uttar Pradesh, who used to work as a driver in Delhi, returned home with ₹18 lakh, which he had stolen from his employer, reports said. He hid the money inside a drum. After the money was recovered, he told police that the idea of hiding the money in a drum came to him from the movie 'Dhol'.

73.title: It's become Cong leaders' habit to demean Hindus: Thakur on Jarkiholi's remark
73.article_body: Following Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', BJP leader Anurag Thakur said it has become a habit for Congress and AAP leaders to demean Hindus and insult Hindu Gods and Goddesses. "Only during elections do they remember Gods and Goddesses. Rest of the time, they keep abusing them," Thakur added.

74.title: Didn't plan to fall in love with man with whom I can't live: Neena on Richards
74.article_body: Talking about her relationship with ex-West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, actress Neena Gupta said, "I didn't plan to fall in love with a person with whom I cannot live and have a child with him." "I never plan to do brave things in life...I never planned to show some act of bravery. I simply accepted...whatever God gave me," added Neena.

75.title: KKR to invest $400 mn in Vedanta's decarbonisation firm Serentica
75.article_body: Global investment firm KKR will invest $400 million in Serentica Renewables, a decarbonization platform that seeks to enable energy transition by providing clean energy solutions. Launched by Vedanta Group, Serentica plans to build 1,500 MW of solar and wind power projects in Karnataka, Maharashtra and Rajasthan. Serentica has entered into three long-term Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs).

76.title: Downturn in startup ecosystem to take 2-3 yrs to normalise: Zoho CEO
76.article_body: SaaS firm Zoho's Co-Founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu said the present economic downturn in the Indian tech and startup ecosystem could take two to three years to normalise. Vembu added, "At current pace, India could be our #2 market in four years and our top market in the next ten years." Chennai-based Zoho recently reported $1 billion in annual revenues.

77.title: Steel plant executive found dead at company's guest house in Odisha
77.article_body: A 59-year-old Jindal Steel and Power Limited plant executive was found dead in Odisha's Sundargarh, police said. The body of the deceased, who worked at a railway siding of the company's iron ore mines, was found by the caretaker of a guest house where he was staying. "It seemed someone hit his head with a blunt object," police added.

78.title: US man pleads guilty for obtaining $3.36 billion in crypto illegally
78.article_body: A US man pleaded guilty on November 4 to committing crypto fraud in September 2012 that amounted to $3.36 billion. The US Department of Justice seized $3.36 billion of bitcoin from James Zhong, who "unlawfully obtained" more than 50,000 bitcoin from dark web market Silk Road over 10 years ago. This was the second-largest financial seizure by the Justice Department.

79.title: Jarkiholi's remark on 'Hindu' his personal opinion, not party's: Shivakumar
79.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka Congress leader Satish Laxmanrao Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar said that his statement is his personal opinion and the party does not support it. "We will ask for his explanation on the same," he added. Jarkiholi on Sunday claimed that the word 'Hindu' hails from Persia and not India.

80.title: European Council Prez's speech for trade expo cancelled by China
80.article_body: The organisers of the 5th China International Import Expo held back a pre-recorded opening ceremony speech by the European Council president wherein he called for reduced EU trade dependency on China, European diplomats said. Charles Michel had also criticised Russia's "illegal war" in Ukraine in the pre-recorded message provided for the state-organised expo in Shanghai, the diplomats added.

81.title: BJP created illusion & smokescreen of growth in Gujarat: Congress
81.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said that BJP has created an "illusion and smokescreen" of high growth in Gujarat and is being ruled as a "vassal state of Delhi". Chidambaram asserted that the promise of a "double engine" government by the BJP was an "empty boast", adding that people, including Scheduled Tribes and women, have been left out.

82.title: UBS to hire 3 Credit Suisse bankers to tap Indian diaspora: Report
82.article_body: UBS Group is hiring three private bankers from the Credit Suisse Group to tap the wealthy Indian diaspora, Bloomberg reported. Gautam Anand, Akshay Menon and Gautam Bhargava will reportedly join UBS in Singapore next year. Anand joined Credit Suisse in 2013, according to his LinkedIn profile. Menon and Bhargava joined Credit Suisse in 2013 and 2010, respectively.

83.title: Hyderabad Police warns against fraud electricity bill messages
83.article_body: Hyderabad Police has warned about fraud messages that threaten to disconnect people's electricity supply if they do not pay the bill immediately. Sub-inspector Gaddam Mahesh said such messages direct victims to a fraudster, who asks them to download screen sharing applications like AnyDesk. The fraudster then steals bank details of the victims and withdraws money from their accounts, Mahesh added.

84.title: I thought we were going to get married: Olivia Culpo on ex-boyfriend Nick
84.article_body: Nick Jonas' ex-girlfriend Olivia Culpo opened up about her past relationship with the singer-songwriter and said that she was under the impression that they would get married. "I moved to LA with him. I had no brand, no money and I was in love...but when he broke up...I was kind of left with no sense of identity," Olivia added.

85.title: Nothing wrong with what I said: Cong leader on his 'Hindu' remark
85.article_body: Responding to his controversial remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi on Tuesday asserted that there was nothing wrong with what he said. Jarkiholi on Sunday said that the word 'Hindu' had Persian origins, adding that it has a "horrible and shameful" meaning. He further said that he'll resign as MLA if he's proven wrong.

86.title: 11 minors arrested in Hyderabad's hookah parlour raid
86.article_body: Hyderabad Detective Department's Special Crime Team raided a hookah parlour at Hyderabad's Himayatnagar and arrested 13 persons including 11 minors who were present there. The police also seized seven hookah pots, three hookah flavours, four alcohol bottles, 14 mobile phones and cash worth ₹2.03 lakh. The owner was running the hookah parlour in one converted portion of the house.

87.title: School van driver blackmails, rapes 14-year-old girl in Nagpur; arrested
87.article_body: Nagpur Police arrested a school van driver for allegedly raping a 14-year-old girl and blackmailing her by threatening to make her photographs viral. The accused allegedly raped her before dropping her off at school. According to the police, the accused kept on blackmailing the girl so that she would continue to be sexually exploited.

88.title: Why should I pay for blue tick now?: Woman who was among 1st Indians to join Twitter
88.article_body: Naina Redhu, who was among the first few Indians to join Twitter when it was launched in 2006, said Twitter's new monthly verification fee plan will not have much effect as it is 'not a necessity'. "If I haven't paid for this (blue tick) in the past 16 years then why should I (pay) now?" said Redhu.

89.title: Will resign if I'm wrong: K'taka Cong leader on his 'Hindu' remark
89.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA and KPCC Working President Satish Jarkiholi, who sparked controversy after saying that the word Hindu has a dirty meaning, has said if he is proven wrong he will resign as MLA. "Let everyone prove I'm wrong. If I am wrong, I'll resign as MLA and not just apologise for my statement," Jarkiholi said on Tuesday.

90.title: Nearly 3 lakh posters, banners removed in 2 days ahead of Delhi MCD polls
90.article_body: Nearly three lakh posters and banners were removed in two days since the Model of Code of Conduct came into effect ahead of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls. A total of 1,20,515 posters and other materials were removed on November 6 and the number increased to 2,91,996 by November 7. MCD elections will be held on December 4.

91.title: Japan repatriates ex-US soldier, son who helped ex-Nissan chief flee
91.article_body: Two Americans who were convicted in Japan for helping former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn escape to Lebanon have been repatriated to the US, their lawyer said on Tuesday. A court in July last year had awarded a prison sentence of two years to Michael Taylor, ex-US Special Forces member, and one year and eight months to his son, Peter Taylor.

92.title: PM Modi writes letter congratulating Palak Muchhal for her wedding, singer shares pic
92.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal, who tied the knot with music composer Mithoon Sharma, shared a letter by PM Narendra Modi, who congratulated the couple on their wedding. "Dear Modi ji, your...letter has touched our hearts. We express our gratitude to you for this respect and love," tweeted Palak. "It's a matter of privilege for us to get your blessings," she added.

93.title: What is Mastodon, the social network users are leaving Twitter for?
93.article_body: Thousands of people who quit Twitter after Elon Musk's takeover have joined Mastodon, a free, open-source decentralised social media platform that allows users to share media and follow other accounts. Mastodon consists of independent, user-managed servers and users are based on one server but can interact freely with others. Unlike Twitter, Mastodon presents posts in chronological order.

94.title: Akshay to revive 'Hera Pheri', 'Awara...' & 'Welcome' franchises: Report
94.article_body: Akshay Kumar is in talks with producer Firoz Nadiadwala to revive 'Hera Pheri', 'Awara Paagal Deewana' and 'Welcome' franchises. "The talks are on with three top directors, and we expect an...announcement on one of the three projects in next few months," a source was quoted as saying. Akshay will next be seen in 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' and 'OMG 2'.

95.title: Mom gets emotional for stupid people, wishes she'd got offers earlier: Masaba
95.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta's daughter Masaba Gupta said that her mother gets emotional for stupid people. "So I tell her, treat people for what they are," she said, adding, "She often says that she wishes that she had received offers earlier in life, just like she's getting now. But, I just keep telling her to be grateful and...enjoy."

96.title: If Suryakumar fails, Team India will struggle to get 140: Gavaskar
96.article_body: Ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, Sunil Gavaskar said India will "struggle" to score 140-150 if Suryakumar Yadav doesn't fire. "Suryakumar has got every shot in the book," added Gavaskar. Gavaskar further stated that India wouldn't have been able to score "even 150" in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe without Suryakumar's unbeaten 61.

97.title: Pune Metro allows passengers to book tickets through WhatsApp
97.article_body: Passengers of Pune Metro can book their QR code-enabled tickets through WhatsApp by sending 'Hi' to the WhatsApp number 9420101990 or by scanning the QR code available at metro stations. They can pay for their tickets and recharge via an integrated payment partner after choosing their travel details on WhatsApp. This service will be available in Marathi, Hindi and English.

98.title: Woman ends life in B'luru as lover threatens to leak private videos
98.article_body: A 35-year-old therapist committed suicide in Bengaluru after her lover demanded ₹2 lakh from her by threatening to upload their private videos online, police said on Tuesday. In a video shot before her death, Chamundeshwari wished her lover, Mallikarjun, good luck in life and asked him not to trouble women in future. Chamundeshwari's husband has filed a complaint against Mallikarjun.

99.title: New monogram for King Charles' wife Camilla revealed
99.article_body: The new monogram for King Charles' wife, Queen Consort Camilla, has been unveiled by Buckingham Palace. Designed by Professor Ewan Clayton, the monogram combines Camilla's initial "C" and "R" for Regina - the Latin word for queen. It will be used by Camilla on personal letterheads, cards and gifts.

100.title: Karan shelved 'Screw Dheela' as Tiger Shroff demanded ₹30 cr: Report
100.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar reportedly shelved 'Screw Dheela' after Tiger Shroff demanded ₹30 crore to do the film. As per a source, Tiger was "very excited" about the project and refused to discuss his fee with Karan. However, his team informed Karan about Tiger's ₹30 crore fee. "Karan tried to explain to Tiger's team...But they wouldn't budge," the source added.

101.title: Don't know if I handled things with grace: Vijay on 'Liger' failure
101.article_body: Talking about how he dealt with Liger's failure, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "I don't know if I've handled things with grace." He added that he's "very honest" about his emotions and expresses them as required. He said he will "always stand by" something that he "truly believes in" and will not be affected by how it is received.

102.title: German insurer Allianz halts paid ads on Twitter after Musk takeover
102.article_body: German insurer Allianz has joined the likes of General Motors, Audi, Volkswagen Group, Pfizer, Carlsberg Group, Mondelez International and General Mills to have suspended paid advertising on Twitter. The move comes after billionaire and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's takeover of the social media platform. Advertising agency Interpublic Group also advised its clients to suspend ads on Twitter.

103.title: Pay attention to your state, says Congress' Alka Lamba to UP CM Yogi
103.article_body: After Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath alleged that the Congress creates hurdles in development and welfare schemes, party leader Alka Lamba told the CM to pay attention to his own state. "Law and order [in UP] is weak. NCR cities like Noida, Ghaziabad...are hotspots of the crime world," said Lamba.

104.title: Dopamine hit from likes, shares extremely addictive: Zerodha CEO on social media
104.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath tweeted, "The dopamine hit from likes & shares is extremely addictive." He added, "Not getting consumed by social media while trying to build an audience has been one of the toughest things I have done in my life." He also said, "If the quality of content goes down, so will that of the audience."

105.title: Buttler, Hales need to be wary of inswingers vs India: Nasser Hussain
105.article_body: Former England captain Nasser Hussain has said that England openers Jos Buttler and Alex Hales will have to be wary of the inswingers while batting against India in their T20 World Cup match on Thursday. "Bhuvneshwar Kumar [against] Buttler and Hales at the top will be key...Then there is the spin threat of Axar Patel and Ravichandran Ashwin," added Hussain.

106.title: Woman, 2 minor daughters found murdered in their house in Rohtak
106.article_body: A 34-year-old woman and her two minor daughters were found murdered in their house in Kalanaur town in Haryana's Rohtak on Monday, police said. "Prima facie, it appeared...trio was strangulated to death...the woman's husband was arrested after her family alleged that he murdered them," police added. The woman's family claimed that the accused was an alcoholic, police stated.

107.title: MSRTC Pune to add new ST, electric buses; scrap 200 old buses
107.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) Pune division has decided to scrap 200 old state transport (ST) buses that have crossed their age limit, which is around 15 years. The corporation will add 50 more e-buses and 80 new ST buses. Currently, there are 448 ST buses and two e-buses in the Pune division.

108.title: Officer probing RSS worker's murder in Kerala allegedly gets death threat
108.article_body: The officer who is investigating the murder of RSS member Srinivasan in Kerala has filed a complaint claiming that he has been receiving threat calls. The officer alleged that a caller told him that he is creating problems and should "keep a coffin ready". So far, a total of 34 PFI workers have been arrested in the case, ANI reported.

109.title: Several parts of Delhi to face water supply disruption on Nov 9-10
109.article_body: Several areas of Delhi will face water supply disruption on the evening of November 9 and the morning of November 10, the Delhi Jal Board (DJB) announced on Monday. Areas including Majnu ka Tilla, Moolchand, Defence Colony, Greater Kailash, Hanuman Mandir and ITO will face water cuts on Wednesday and Thursday. DJB also shared a list of emergency contact numbers.

110.title: RRR will be minuscule in comparison: Rajamouli on Mahabharata adaptation
110.article_body: Discussing his desire to make a film based on Mahabharata, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said, "['RRR'] is minuscule and an ant's head...[compared to] what the [film on] Mahabharata can be." "However, the kind of imagery that I have...for the Mahabharata, I think I need more time, I need to learn more film craft to get it on the screen," added Rajamouli.

111.title: Donetsk 'littered' with Russian bodies as hundreds killed daily: Zelenskyy
111.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the Donetsk region in the east remained "the epicenter of the greatest madness of the occupiers [Russia]". "They're being killed in their hundreds every day. The ground in front of Ukrainian positions is littered with bodies of the occupiers," he added. Bakhmut and Avdiivka towns are the focal points of the heaviest fighting in Donetsk.

112.title: Attack on husband to impact my retirement decision: US House Speaker Pelosi
112.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has said that the recent incident, in which a hammer-wielding intruder attacked her husband Paul Pelosi, will have an impact on her decision about when to retire from Congress. In an interview with CNN, Pelosi said the hard part was knowing that she was the attacker's intended victim and her husband paid the price.

113.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu breaks down while speaking about battling Myositis, video surfaces
113.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who has been diagnosed with Myositis, broke down while talking about it in an interview. "There are days when I feel....I can't take one more step further. And there are days when I look back, I feel surprised that I've come so far," she said. "I'm here to fight...We win in the end," Samantha added.

114.title: 2,000-year-old tunnel discovered under temple in Egypt; pics released
114.article_body: Archaeologists in Egypt excavating beneath an ancient temple in the ancient city of Taposiris Magna have discovered a 1,300-metre-long tunnel dating back over 2,000 years. Archaeologist Kathleen Martinez said that during the excavations and survey of the tunnel, a part of the tunnel was discovered submerged under the Mediterranean water, a number of pottery vessels and pottery tractors were found.

115.title: 'Being gay is damage in mind,' Qatar World Cup envoy tells reporter; interview stopped
115.article_body: The 2022 FIFA World Cup ambassador Khalid Salman told a German journalist that homosexuality or being gay is "damage in the mind", after which a World Cup spokesperson stopped the interview. In a clip shared online, Salman is heard saying that homosexuality is "haram" or forbidden. Concerns have been raised over LGBTQ rights in Qatar ahead of the World Cup.

116.title: Rise in crime in Bihar since Nitish Kumar's alliance with RJD: Sushil Modi
116.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Monday said crime graph took a huge spike in Bihar ever since CM Nitish Kumar joined hands with the RJD and formed the government. "RJD is a party where criminals were given shelter in the past," Sushil Kumar Modi added. "Leaders like Raj Ballabh Yadav of Nawada...are involved in various criminal cases," he stated.

117.title: GreenCell receives $55 million debt funding to develop 255 e-buses
117.article_body: Electric bus manufacturing startup GreenCell has secured a $55 million financing package from Asian Development Bank, Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank and Clean Technology Fund to develop 255 electric battery-powered buses. The company received grants worth $5.2 million from Goldman Sachs and Bloomberg-backed Climate Innovation and Development Fund and $325,000 from Clean Technology Fund.

118.title: Sugarcane farmers stage protest in Pune over various demands
118.article_body: Sugarcane farmers from across Maharashtra took out protest march from Alka Chowk to Sugar Commissionerate office in Pune on Monday for their various demands from the state government. Some of their demands include - installation of digital weighing scales at sugar mills and they also demanded ₹350 per tonne for their produce apart from the Fair and Remunerative Price (FRP).

119.title: NCP leader booked for vandalism after stopping film screening in Thane
119.article_body: Nationalist Congress party leader Jitendra Awhad and 100 others have been booked for vandalism after they stooped the screening of a Marathi film 'Har Har Mahadev' in Thane. Awhad alleged that the movie showcases wrong history about Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. He said that people are influenced by movies and they won't let them change history.

120.title: 5 people injured in cylinder blast in Mumbai's Vile Parle
120.article_body: Five people were injured in a cylinder blast which took place at New Kalpana Chawl in Vile Parle, Mumbai on Tuesday. It was a level-1 cylinder blast and was reported around 6 am, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said. The injured have been identified as Amar Rai (27), Jayram Yadav (27), Harekumar Rai (38), Rakeshkumar Rai (30) and Arunkumar Rai (45).

121.title: 3 including couple who stole 73 vehicles in Delhi, Gurugram held
121.article_body: Three people, including a couple, were arrested for stealing 73 vehicles in Delhi and Gurugram, police said on Monday. Two vehicles, which were stolen from Gurugram, were recovered after the accused were interrogated and their licence plates were also seized, the police added. The accused would steal vehicles and supply them to northeast states, the police further said.

122.title: B'luru Police raids 3 illegal hookah bars, books staff members
122.article_body: The Bengaluru Police carried out raids at three hookah bars operating illegally and beyond the permissible time in the city, a senior police official tweeted on Monday. "Seized equipment, hookah flavours and total cash worth ₹14,000 from three hookah bars," he added. Reportedly, the police also booked the managers and staff members of the hookah bars.

123.title: Education not a business to earn profit, tuition fee must be affordable: SC
123.article_body: The Supreme Court observed that education is not a business to earn profit and the tuition fee shall always be affordable. A bench of justices MR Shah and Sudhanshu Dhulia made these remarks while upholding Andhra Pradesh High Court's order which set aside the state government's decision to enhance the tuition fee payable by the MBBS students.

124.title: Shaheen holds the key for Pakistan's progression in T20 WC: Ponting
124.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said pacer Shaheen Afridi holds the key for Pakistan's progression in the ongoing T20 World Cup. "Shaheen might say that he's not back to 100% just yet, but from what I've seen it looks like he's going along beautifully," stated Ponting. Shaheen picked four wickets in their must-win Super 12 match against Bangladesh.

125.title: 'Musk's hellscape', 'free hate speech' projected on Twitter HQ's wall, pics surface
125.article_body: A California based-activist projected "Musk's hellscape" and "free hate speech" on the wall of Twitter's headquarters in San Francisco. Sharing pictures of the phrases he projected on the wall, Alan Marling wrote, "Elon [Musk] seems to have no concept of free speech, so projected an example on Twitter HQ." Musk acquired Twitter on October 27 in a $44 billion deal.

126.title: Shami shares pic from forest, says 'No Wi-Fi, but I promise you'll find better connection'
126.article_body: Ahead of India's semi-final match against England in the ongoing T20 World Cup, Mohammad Shami took to Twitter to share a photo of him relaxing in Australia. "There's no Wi-Fi in the forest, but I promise you'll find a better connection," he captioned the photo. Shami has picked six wickets in India's five games so far in the tournament.

127.title: Rahul Gandhi offers prayers at gurudwara in Maha, resumes 'padyatra'
127.article_body: On the occasion of Guru Nanak Jayanti, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited a gurudwara in the Nanded district of Maharashtra just before the commencement of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Tuesday. He took to Twitter and said, "By applying Guru Nanak's teachings of love, peace and brotherhood, we will fulfil [the] resolve to unite India. Lakhs of greetings...to all."

128.title: 2 held for allegedly running over former intelligence officer in Mysore University campus
128.article_body: An MBA graduate and his friend have been arrested for allegedly running over 82-year-old former Intelligence Bureau officer inside Mysore University campus. Police said they murdered him over property dispute. The officer was walking inside campus when he was hit by a car. It was earlier believed that it was an accident but speculations of it being murder surfaced later.

129.title: Will make a big announcement on November 15: ex-US President Trump
129.article_body: During a political rally in US state of Ohio, former US President Donald Trump said he would make a "big announcement" on November 15 at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Florida. Trump declined to elaborate, saying he didn't want to detract from important and critical election. He said US is a "nation in decline" under the leadership of President Joe Biden.

130.title: Sah Polymers gets SEBI approval to float IPO
130.article_body: Polymer manufacturer Sah Polymers has received the market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India's (SEBI) approval to raise funds through an Initial Public Offering (IPO). According to draft papers, Sah Polymers' IPO will be a fresh issue of 1.02 crore equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. The Udaipur-based company had filed preliminary IPO papers with SEBI in April.

131.title: Off-duty pilot objects to flyers using business-class toilet amid medical emergency
131.article_body: The crew of Kozhikode-Delhi Air India flight has filed a complaint against an off-duty AI Express pilot after a medical emergency on Sunday. A passenger was unwell and he was made to lie down in the aisle near a washroom. The crew then allowed economy-class passengers to use the business-class washroom but the pilot objected and ranted for 15 minutes.

132.title: Delhi Metro introduces its first 8-coach trains on Red Line
132.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) introduced its first-ever set of two eight-coach trains on Red Line, which have been converted from the existing fleet of 39 six-coach trains. These metros will run from Rithala to Shaheed Sthal New Bus Adda starting today. DMRC is also undertaking conversion of remaining six-coach trains on Red, Yellow and Blue lines, officials said.

133.title: Suffered, endured & enjoyed: Neena on being single mother to Masaba
133.article_body: Neena Gupta said that she took the decision to give birth to her daughter Masaba Gupta out of wedlock and stood by it despite hardships. "I suffered, endured and also enjoyed all that (phase)," she said, adding that she never took any sort of financial or emotional help from anyone. She added that she "simply accepted" God's plans for her.

134.title: Today's lunar eclipse to be visible from B'luru, will last for 29 mins
134.article_body: Today's lunar eclipse will be visible from Bengaluru and will last for 29 minutes. "For...Bengaluru...at the time of moonrise, the partial eclipse after...end of totality will be in progress and...the duration from the moonrise time up to the end of the partial eclipse will be...29 minutes," the Ministry of Earth Sciences said. The total eclipse will end at 5:12 pm.

135.title: Drunk man kills 2-year-old son for crying in Hyderabad
135.article_body: A man, who was in an inebriated condition, allegedly killed his two-year-old son in Hyderabad's Neredmet on Monday night. "Frustrated over the cries of the child, the accused hit him against the ground. The child sustained injuries and died," an official of Neredmet police station said. The man was taken into police custody.

136.title: A competitor's trying to go after us: FTX CEO on 'false' insolvency rumours
136.article_body: FTX's billionaire Founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried said, "FTX is fine. Assets are fine," amid insolvency rumours after its competitor Binance announced plans to liquidate its entire holdings of FTX's native tokens. "A competitor is trying to go after us with false rumours," he tweeted, adding that FTX keeps "audited financials" and is "highly regulated".

137.title: 5 wagons of goods train derail in Jhansi; rail traffic affected
137.article_body: Five wagons of a goods train derailed in Jhansi's Virangana Lakshmibai railway station yard on Tuesday, rail officials said. The derailment, which took place around 5.30 am, has affected both up and down traffic on Jhansi-Mustra and Jhansi-Karari sections, the PRO said. The PRO added that efforts are on to restore services and that some trains were diverted.

138.title: President Murmu and PM Modi wish everyone on Guru Nanak Jayanti
138.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone a happy Guru Nanak Jayanti. President Murmu urged people to adopt the teachings of Japji Sahib, like truth, sacrifice and moral conduct. PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "May his noble teachings continue to guide us in our endeavour of building a...compassionate society."

139.title: China playing aggressive games with Canada democracy: Trudeau
139.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said that China is playing "aggressive games" with democracies and Canadian institutions. This comes after a local media report claimed that China had funded a "clandestine network" of candidates in Canada's 2019 election. The report also alleged that Beijing sought to place agents in the offices of members of the Parliament in order to influence policy.

140.title: Special players don't stay down for long: Hayden on Babar, Rizwan
140.article_body: Speaking ahead of their semi-final against New Zealand in the T20 World Cup, Pakistan mentor Matthew Hayden backed their openers Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan to regain form, stating that special players don't stay down for long. "Babar and Rizwan rightly are [the] number one combination," he added. Babar has scored 39 runs in five innings in the ongoing tournament.

141.title: Ashwin reacts to viral video of him smelling jackets during toss against Zimbabwe
141.article_body: India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has reacted after he was caught on camera smelling warm-up jackets during toss against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022. On being asked by Abhinav Mukund about his logic of picking the right "sweater", Ashwin tweeted, "Checked for...sizes to differentiate! (didn't work) Checked if it was initialed (didn't work) Finally checked for...the perfume i use (worked)."

142.title: 'Are you going to pay $8, Elon?' asks Twitter user on blue tick fee, Musk says '100%'
142.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday shared a photo of a T-shirt with a text that read, "Your feedback is appreciated. Now pay $8", a response he had given to US lawmaker Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez regarding the $8 blue tick subscription service. Commenting on it, a Twitter user wrote, "Are you going to pay the $8, Elon?" to which he replied 100%.

143.title: UPI frauds led to 15.3% rise in cybercrime complaints between Q1, Q2 in 2022: MHA
143.article_body: The unified payments interface (UPI) frauds contributed to a 15.3% increase in the overall number of complaints reported on the National Cybercrime Reporting Portal between the first and second quarters of 2022, the Ministry of Home Affairs data showed. The overall number of registered complaints in Q1 of 2022 was 2,06,198, while it grew to 2,37,658 in the second quarter.

144.title: Dead cobra found in Ghaziabad society's water tank, police complaint filed
144.article_body: A dead cobra was found inside the water tank of a society in Ghaziabad. Reports said that the residents of the society had been complaining of skin rashes and stomach infections. A police complaint was lodged against the developer of the society. The residents claimed the snake was found in the tank that stored drinking water.

145.title: Man cuts childhood friend's private parts, stuffs them in his mouth in Maharashtra
145.article_body: A 21-year-old hotel owner was murdered by his childhood friend who stabbed him nine times, cut his private parts and stuffed them in his mouth in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. Aslam Ansari used to like Shamim Ansari's girlfriend and when Shamim refused to leave her he murdered him. The incident happened when they were having a party in the hotel of deceased.

146.title: BBMP invites applications to hire 63 doctors at Namma Clinics in B'luru
146.article_body: After completing the process of appointing 180 doctors last month, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) invited applications to hire 63 more doctors. The clinics are scheduled to open on December 15, officials said. Out of 438 Namma Clinics across Karnataka, 243 will be operational in Bengaluru. We hope to complete the hiring process this month, a BBMP official said.

147.title: 1,800 Bihar healthcare centres issued closure warning over waste disposal
147.article_body: The Bihar State Pollution Control Board (BSPCB) said it has issued closure warning notices to 1,800 healthcare centres in six districts across the state for not complying with the norms of bio-medical waste disposal. If these centres fail to adhere to the norms of treatment of medical waste within 15 days, their closure will be ordered, BSPCB added.

148.title: Delhi HC awards Louis Vuitton ₹20 lakh in trademark violation case against Club Factory
148.article_body: The Delhi High Court has awarded ₹20 lakh to Louis Vuitton in its trademark infringement suit against Club Factory, a Chinese e-shopping platform that was banned in India. In the suit filed in 2020, Louis Vuitton alleged that the Club Factory website indulged in the unauthorised sale of its products that carried the marks of Louis Vuitton.

149.title: Situation is tough, no one is going to theatres: Amitabh Bachchan
149.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has requested fans to buy tickets and watch films at theatres. He said, "Aajkal badi maramari chal ri hai, koi ja hi nahi raha hai theatre mein (The situation is very tough these days. No one is going to the theatre)." Adding to him, Neena Gupta informed that the tickets for their upcoming film 'Uunchai' will cost ₹150.

150.title: Suryakumar's record against slow left-arm spin doesn't stand out: Hussain
150.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain termed Suryakumar Yadav as a "freakish talent", but added that his record against slow left-arm spin "doesn't really stand out". "It is hard to find any weakness," stated Hussain. Ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis had earlier termed "bombarding" Suryakumar with short deliveries as the best as well as the "only way" to dismiss him in T20s.

151.title: Several actors have wrong intentions from the beginning of a film: Boney
151.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor said there are several actors who have "wrong" intentions from the beginning of a film. "[Their] first thought process is dishonest...The film won't be successful in case of an absence of honesty," added Boney. "Several actors charge fully for 25-30 days of work...There are quite a few actors who want everything to be convenient," he stated.

152.title: Man sexually exploits woman on pretext of marriage in Pune
152.article_body: A case has been filed after a man allegedly sexually exploited a 31-year-old woman on the pretext of marriage in Pune. The woman said in her complaint that when she asked about the marriage later, the accused refused and physically assaulted her, according to police officials. The accused and the woman are both members of a library, police said.

153.title: Punjab man gets trapped in fire caused by stubble burning; rescued
153.article_body: A 29-year-old man suffered burn injuries after he got trapped in a fire caused by stubble burning in Punjab's Ferozepur on Monday. Passers-by had rescued the man, however, his two-wheeler was reportedly reduced to ashes in the incident. The man, who is a barber, claimed that he had fallen unconscious after getting trapped in the fire.

154.title: Versova-Andheri metro ridership rises after Gokhale bridge closure
154.article_body: Ridership of stations in Mumbai's Andheri, namely Versova, DN Nagar and Azad Nagar increased by over 17% after the closure of Gokhale bridge, which connected the east and west sides of Andheri. The overall ridership on Versova-Andheri-Ghatkopar blue line increased by around 11,000 passengers yesterday (till 5 pm), compared to last Monday, according to Mumbai Metro One Private Limited's data.

155.title: Deloitte India fires employee who ran global hacking gang that targeted ex-Pak PM
155.article_body: Deloitte India has fired Aditya Jain, a 31-year-old employee who ran a global hacking group named 'WhiteInt' out of a Gurugram apartment. He ran a network of hackers who were hired to steal email inboxes of their targets. Jain's firm reportedly targeted former Pakistan PM Pervez Musharraf, BMW co-owner Stefan Quandt and members of UK's wealthiest families, including Ashok Hinduja.

156.title: Bus meets with an accident in J&K's Handwara; 20 people injured
156.article_body: At least 20 people were injured after a bus they were travelling in met with an accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Handwara on Tuesday. Officials said that the bus had turned turtle while on its way to Srinagar, Kashmir News Observer reported. Earlier, six people were injured in a car accident on the snow-covered Gulmarg-Butapathri road, a press release said.

157.title: Cong's Krishna Kumar Pandey dies while participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra
157.article_body: Congress leader Krishna Kumar Pandey died on Tuesday while participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra which entered Maharashtra. "Pandey, General Secretary of Seva Dal, was holding the national flag and walking with Digvijaya Singh and me...He handed the flag to a colleague...Thereafter he collapsed," Congress' Jairam Ramesh tweeted. Pandey was taken to hospital where he was declared dead, Ramesh stated.

158.title: Shocking that no one apologised: Chidambaram on Morbi bridge collapse
158.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said it is shocking that no one has apologised or resigned for the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy in Gujarat. He added, "Gujarat is governed from Delhi and not by the Chief Minister." "ED and CBI are working at BJP's behest, 95% of those arrested by such agencies are Opposition politicians," Chidambaram stated.

159.title: 21-yr-old threatens & harasses former schoolmate, arrested in Chennai
159.article_body: The Chennai Police on Monday arrested a 21-year-old, identified as V Gautham, for allegedly harassing a 19-year-old woman and threatening to upload her pictures on the internet if she didn't continue her relations with him. The victim and accused were schoolmates. He approached her on November 4 and when she refused to talk to him, he created a ruckus.

160.title: N Korea denies US claims of sending weapons to Russia amid Ukraine war
160.article_body: North Korea has denied US claims that it is shipping artillery shells and ammunition to Russia to be used in the war against Ukraine. This comes after North Korea conducted a series of weapons tests which included short-range and intercontinental missiles. Pyongyang said it was testing weapons to "mercilessly" strike key US and South Korean targets if it chooses to.

161.title: 2 Nigerian TikTok stars to be whipped 20 times for mocking govt official
161.article_body: A judge in Nigeria has ordered two TikTok stars to be given 20 lashes each, pay a $22 fine and clean the court for 30 days after they used the social media app to mock a government official. Mubarak Isa Muhammed and Muhammed Bula allegedly defamed Kano State's Governor, Abdullahi Ganduje, by saying he's corrupt, sells people's land and oversleeps.

162.title: Still processing Chadwick Boseman's loss: 'Black Panther...' actress Lupita
162.article_body: 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' actress Lupita Nyong'o said the team is still processing the loss of Chadwick Boseman. "Chadwick left a very big hole," she said, adding that the sequel "honours" the actor's legacy. She added that she's "glad" the makers "didn't replace" Chadwick and is hopeful that the film will encourage people who've lost hope to move forward.

163.title: Anti-dumping duty on Chinese metal cutter wheels not to be imposed
163.article_body: As the Finance Ministry has not accepted the recommendations of the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) for imposing anti-dumping duty on Chinese metal cutter wheels, the government has decided not to impose the levy. DGTR, under the Commerce Ministry, conducted a probe into the alleged dumping of "Resin Bonded Thin Wheels" from China and recommended imposition of the duty.

164.title: Not dying anytime soon: Samantha after media calls Myositis diagnosis 'life-threatening'
164.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who recently revealed that she has been diagnosed with autoimmune condition Myositis, has clarified that her Myositis is not at a stage that is life-threatening. "I saw a lot of articles describing my condition as life-threatening. But the stage I am in, it's not life-threatening for me. I am not dying anytime soon," she said.

165.title: Man's 'UFO' pic to friend amid smog in Delhi goes viral
165.article_body: A picture sent by a man to his friend amid the smog in Delhi has gone viral on social media. The man's friend shared the picture of a "flying saucer" in Delhi which turned out to be a water tower. Reacting to the picture, that looked similar to a "UFO", a user wrote, "That really is very depressing."

166.title: UP court defers verdict on plea for Shivling worship at Gyanvapi mosque
166.article_body: A fast-track court in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, on Tuesday didn't pronounce a verdict on the maintainability of the plea seeking the worship of Shivling that the Hindu side claimed was found on the premises of the Gyanvapi mosque. The matter will be heard on November 14. The plea also demands handing over complex to Hindus and banning entry of Muslims.

167.title: Can't fire that many people & expect site to be healthy: Early Twitter investor on layoffs
167.article_body: One of Twitter's early investors, Chris Sacca, has shared a thread about Elon Musk's takeover of the social media company. Talking about the recent layoffs at the company, Sacca wrote, "So much product and policy talent was pushed out the company door...you just can't fire that many engineers, ops, and SREs and expect the site to stay healthy."

168.title: What did SC say on acquitting 3 men sentenced to death for rape-murder of 19-yr-old girl?
168.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday acquitted three men sentenced to death by a trial court for the gangrape and murder of a 19-year-old girl in Delhi in 2012. The court said the prosecution, whose case rested on circumstantial evidence, had failed to prove it. "The court has noticed many glaring lapses having occurred during the course of the trial," it added.

169.title: Was diagnosed with spondylitis during 'Jhalak...': Paras Kalnawat
169.article_body: Actor Paras Kalnawat revealed that he was diagnosed with spondylitis during 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. He said that he also had muscle tear in his knees but he didn't want to quit the show as it "was more important" to him than his health. "I've been popping medicines and muscle relaxants to not feel the pain while rehearsing," he added.

170.title: Haryana woman sarpanch arrested for booth capturing in panchayat polls
170.article_body: A newly-elected woman sarpanch was arrested for her alleged involvement in capturing a booth in the November 2 panchayat elections in Haryana's Nuh, police said. "After filing an FIR, we investigated and found the involvement of the newly-elected sarpanch Rashida and arrested her. We are also verifying the role of others and they will be arrested soon," police added.

171.title: Smoke weed but understand importance of water conservation: BJP MP
171.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Janardan Mishra said that he does not have a problem if people chew tobacco, drink alcohol, smoke weed, inhale thinner or spend money on religious works. "But do understand the importance of water conservation," he said at a workshop. He added that water must be saved and that lands are running dry.

172.title: 3 police jurisdictions in Pune to get new deputy commissioners of police
172.article_body: The three police jurisdictions in the Pune district, Pune City, Pimpri Chinchwad and Pune rural, will get new deputy commissioners of police (DCPs). The new Pune city DCPs will be Sandeep Singh Gill, Shashikant Borate, Smartana Patil, Vijaykumar Magar, Vikrant Deshmukh, Suhail Sharma and Amol Zende. This comes after the Maharashtra Home Department ordered the reshuffle of 104 police officers.

173.title: No player has the guts to even attempt Suryakumar's scoop shot: Kaif
173.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said he doesn't think "any player has the guts to even attempt" the scoop shot played by Suryakumar Yadav. "Every player...[is fearful] that the ball will splice off the bat and hit the grill," added Kaif. "However, Suryakumar's different, forget the fear of getting hit, he's scoring [the] bulk of his runs with that...shot," he stated.

174.title: Chris Evans named 2022's Sexiest Man Alive by People magazine
174.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Evans has been named as People magazine's 'Sexiest Man Alive' for 2022. The 41-year-old 'Captain America' actor said that the title "feels like a weird form of humble bragging" and added, "My mom will be so happy."
