349.article_body: An Odisha Police Havildar was suspended for allegedly hitting a 65-year-old elderly woman with a cane stick inside Shree Jagannatha Temple in the state's Puri district. The woman, Madhuri Das, got into an argument with the Havildar, Prashant Dalai, before the latter hit on her head. Das was immediately taken to a hospital by other security personnel, police said.

350.title: 2 ex-Punjab Police officers get life term in 29-yr-old fake encounter case
350.article_body: Two former Punjab Police officers have been sentenced to life imprisonment in a 29-year-old fake encounter case that took place in the Tarn Taran district. The case pertains to 1993 when a resident of Uboke was shown as killed. The CBI had filed a case against the police officials in 1999.

351.title: Please get out: Kerala Governor to 2 journalists during press meet
351.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday barred two journalists from CPI(M)-backed Kairali TV and Jamaat-e-Islami-backed MediaOne TV from taking part in his interaction with the media in Kochi. "Please get out," Khan told the journalists. "They were lowering the dignity of the office despite repeated reminders from the Raj Bhavan," he added, while referring to the media organisations.

352.title: Vote for good 'malis' who will watch over your garden: Nadda in HP
352.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Monday urged Himachal Pradesh voters to vote for good 'malis' who will watch over their gardens, adding that they shouldn't vote on the basis of emotions. Nadda accused Congress of trying to confuse the voters, saying "those who have nothing to show always tend to confuse the voters and undermine the democratic process".

353.title: There will never be a sequel to 'English Vinglish': Adil Hussain
353.article_body: Adil Hussain, when asked if makers of 'English Vinglish' are planning to make its sequel, said, "I...saw Gauri Shinde's (director) statement that there will never be...sequel to [film]." "We were supposed to make...[sequel] even after Sridevi passed away...then somebody else passed away. The person who plays...[Sridevi's sister]...also passed away. Gauri probably took that as a sign," he added.

354.title: BBMP to send principals of schools with 100% pass results on tours
354.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will send principals of schools with 100% pass results in Secondary School Leaving Certificate and Higher Secondary exams on trips to Kashmir and Singapore. "This scheme will be arranged through the Corporate Social Responsibility initiative. If students score 100%, they too will be sent to Singapore," said BBMP Special Commissioner RP Manohar.

355.title: 18-yr-old kidnaps 14-yr-old girl in Mumbai, traced within hours
355.article_body: An 18-year-old youth was traced by police within hours after he allegedly kidnapped a 14-year-old girl from Mumbai's Bandra, an official said on Monday. A team of police and crime branch officials was formed to trace the girl after she went missing, the official said. Police analysed CCTV footage and found that a man had taken the girl with him.

356.title: Delhi man, sister-in-law pose as Yonex badminton kit dealers, held
356.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested and his sister-in-law was apprehended for allegedly cheating people on social media posing as authorised dealers of Yonex badminton kits, police said on Monday. A complainant said that he met someone on Facebook who presented himself as a Yonex dealer. He placed an order for a badminton kit and paid ₹3,03,500, police said.

357.title: Foreign national held with heroin worth ₹18 cr at Mumbai airport
357.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation seized 6 kg of heroin worth ₹18 crore in the international market from a foreign national at Mumbai airport. The accused has been arrested, reports said. In another incident, officials of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested three persons and seized narcotics worth ₹15 crore from the Mumbai international airport cargo on October 20.

358.title: IndiGo grounds about 30 aircraft due to 'supply chain disruptions'
358.article_body: IndiGo on Monday said that it grounded about 30 aircraft due to "supply chain disruptions". "While it is our...priority to deploy adequate capacity to serve our customers, we're actively engaged with...OEM (original equipment manufacturer) partners to work on mitigation measures that should ensure the continuity of our network," it said. IndiGo had 279 aircraft in its fleet as of September-end.

359.title: Lab-grown blood given to humans in a world-first clinical trial
359.article_body: Red blood cells grown in a laboratory have been transfused into humans in a world-first clinical trial. The manufactured blood cells were grown from stem cells from donors and then transfused into two people by UK researchers. If proven safe and effective, it could help in the treatment of people with sickle cell and rare blood types.

360.title: upGrad earmarks $30 mn for 10 global campuses in India, US, Singapore
360.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad announced that it'll invest $30 million to open 10 global campuses next year in US, India, Singapore and the Middle East. "This is a natural extension as we move to a very scaled blended offline and online model under our own upGrad brand," said Ronnie Screwvala, Co-founder, upGrad. Currently, upGrad has facilities in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Bengaluru.

361.title: Who will play whom in the Champions League round of 16?
361.article_body: Defending champions Real Madrid will face runners-up Liverpool in the Champions League 2022-23 round of 16. Meanwhile, Manchester City will play against RB Leipzig in the last 16. AC Milan will face Tottenham Hotspur, while Dortmund will face Chelsea. The first leg of round of 16 will take place in February 2023.

362.title: Pak PM spotted using phone as world leaders meet at COP27; video surfaces
362.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif was spotted checking his phone as the world leaders around him engaged in conversations at the COP27 climate change conference in Egypt. "While world leaders are busy discussing respective bilateral ties, Pakistan's Prime Minister is busy using his phone," Pakistan's political party PTI tweeted. "Every foreign visit is a new embarrassment for Pakistan," it added.

363.title: Was told 'Stop working, start cooking for Rajeev, he'll be happy': Charu
363.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa revealed that her estranged husband Rajeev Sen has a habit of blocking her on the phone. She added that his family is also annoyed with him. "So they would tell me to be mature. You stop working for 6 months, start cooking for him, he'll be...happy," Charu said, adding she "gave up on work...to keep him happy".

364.title: Local BJP leader shot dead by bike-borne men near his house in Bihar
364.article_body: A local BJP leader was shot dead by two bike-borne men near his house in Bihar's Katihar district on Monday, police said. The former Zilla Parishad member, Sanjeev Mishra, was taken to the hospital where he was declared brought dead. His supporters gathered outside police station and damaged several police vehicles parked there.

365.title: Love to see India-Pakistan final in T20 WC 2022: Shane Watson
365.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that everyone would love to see India and Pakistan competing against each other in the final of the T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "I unfortunately missed that first (Super 12) game at the MCG...But from all reports, all the people that went along to that game said it was something very special," Watson said.

366.title: Murugha Mutt seer drugged, abused minor girls of choice in room: Report
366.article_body: Karnataka's Sri Murugha Mutt chief pontiff Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru allegedly drugged minor girls before abusing them, a police investigation has revealed. The accused seer asked another accused to send a minor girl of his choice to his private room, where he gave them chocolate laced with drugs, following which he abused and threatened them, reports said.

367.title: Philippines prisons chief ordered Oct killing of journalist: Police
367.article_body: Police in the Philippines on Monday accused Gerald Bantag, the chief of the country's prisons department, of ordering the killing of radio journalist Percival Mabasa who was shot dead on October 3. A complaint has been filed against Bantag and his deputy, Ricardo Zulueta. Bantag allegedly ordered the killing as Mabasa continued to expose issues linked to him.

368.title: 10,583 flat owners get tax rebate of ₹55 lakh for green projects in PCMC
368.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nilesh Deshmukh has said that 10,583 flat owners have received a 5-10% tax rebate for the implementation of green projects. He said, "42 [societies]...have been implementing sewage treatment and zero waste projects." "These societies have 10,583 flats and all the flat owners have received a rebate of ₹55 lakh," he said.

369.title: Rethink age of consent under POCSO Act: Karnataka High Court to Law Commission of India
369.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has directed the Law Commission of India to reconsider the age of consent in Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. "The aspect of consent even by a girl of 16 years and above would've to be considered if there's indeed an offence under the IPC and/or POCSO Act," the court said.

370.title: 32 lakh weddings in India within 41 days to generate ₹3.75 lakh crore business: CAIT
370.article_body: Around 32 lakh weddings are expected to take place in India between November 4 and December 14, which will generate a business of ₹3.75 lakh crore for the country's traders, a Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) survey said. In Delhi alone, 3.5 lakh weddings will generate a business of ₹75,000 crore. The CAIT surveyed 4,302 traders in 35 cities.

371.title: BJP should seek votes in HP on report card and not manifesto: Cong
371.article_body: The Congress said the BJP should seek votes in Himachal Pradesh based on its report card and not its manifesto. It also challenged the ruling party to spell out the promises it has fulfilled instead of making fresh ones. Yesterday, BJP President JP Nadda released the party's manifesto promising Uniform Civil Code and 33% reservation for women in government jobs.

372.title: We'll check his stars: Supreme Court on compensation for astrologer who met with accident
372.article_body: While hearing a case on accident compensation of an astrologer, the Supreme Court said that it is surprised that an astrologer had an accident. "We will check his stars," the court said. The identity of the astrologer and specific case details are not yet known. "Court is the biggest astrologer of everyone's stars," a Twitter user joked.

373.title: 'Adipurush' makers to spend additional ₹100 crore to improve VFX: Report
373.article_body: 'Adipurush' makers will reportedly spend an extra ₹100 crore to improve the VFX of the film. This comes after the release date of 'Adipurush', which is reportedly made on the budget of ₹450-500 crore, has been postponed to June 16, 2023. Several users on Twitter trolled the teaser of the film over Saif Ali Khan's look and the film's VFX.

374.title: Right-wing group asks B'luru Police to revoke permission for Vir Das' show
374.article_body: A right-wing group, Janajagruthi Vedike, has urged Bengaluru Police to cancel permission given to comedian Vir Das to hold his show in the city. A letter submitted at the Vyalikaval Police Station by Mohan Gowda, state spokesperson of the outfit, stated that Das passed derogatory comments about women and PM Narendra Modi, which "denigrated the nation".

375.title: Raj businessman suffers cardiac arrest while reading newspaper, video surfaces
375.article_body: A video showing a 61-year-old man in Rajasthan suffering a cardiac arrest while reading a newspaper at a clinic has gone viral. The deceased, a garment businessman, visited a clinic for a toothache he developed. The deceased can be seen sitting in the waiting room before collapsing, following which a woman sitting at the reception rushed to help him.

376.title: Dad has 3 daughters, this is deja vu for him: Mahesh's son on Alia's baby
376.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt's son Rahul Bhatt, in an interview, talked about how his father is excited about Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's daughter. "He couldn't wait for...baby's arrival," Rahul said, adding, "What...happened is...he has had three daughters (Pooja, Shaheen and Alia)...so it's...deja vu of sorts for him. He's comparing this to the time when his first daughter, Pooja was born."

377.title: 'Zeher Khurani' gang robs people using sleeping pills in Delhi, 3 held
377.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested three members of the 'Zeher Khurani' gang, which is known for robbing people after sedating them with sleeping pills. According to the police, the gang would make people eat sweets mixed with powdered sleeping pills and would rob them after they would get unconscious. The arrested persons have been identified as Kamal Singh, Pawan and Gourav.

378.title: SC acquits 3 rape and murder convicts called 'predators' by Delhi HC
378.article_body: Supreme Court has acquitted three convicts, Ravi Kumar, Rahul and Vinod, sentenced to death after being held guilty of raping and killing a 19-year-old woman in 2012. Delhi High Court also confirmed the punishment, saying they were "predators" moving on streets looking for prey. The victim's body was found with injuries due to assault with car tools and earthen pots.

379.title: Sridevi was sick, but still shot 'Kate Nahin...' song: Boney on 'Mr India'
379.article_body: Filmmaker Boney Kapoor recalled that actress Sridevi continued to shoot for Mr India's 'Kate Nahin' song even when she was sick. "Sri fell sick during the shoot for 2-3 days, but still shot the song with a temperature," he shared. Boney said the song took 21 days to shoot, while the complete film was shot in around 380 days.

380.title: Samantha never revealed she had Myositis, felt sad: 'Yashoda' actor
380.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Yashoda' co-star Unni Mukundan said that he wasn't aware of the actress' health condition. He said Samantha "never mentioned" that she was diagnosed with Myositis. "I didn't know it...I felt sad after seeing Samantha's post. She'll fight it and come back in good health," the actor added. He described Samantha as a "very dedicated and hardworking" actress.

381.title: Anusha Dandekar's startup BrownSkin Beauty raises ₹3.5 crore: Report
381.article_body: Direct-to-consumer skincare startup BrownSkin Beauty has reportedly raised ₹3.5 crore in seed funding from Sequoia Capital India at an undisclosed valuation. The brand, which caters products exclusively to Indian skin tones, was founded by VJ, actor and television host Anusha Dandekar and Gaurav Kumar. The report further added that the fundraise talks had been on since August.

382.title: Shruti Haasan shares childhood pic of father Kamal Haasan on his b'day
382.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan, taking to her Instagram Stories on Monday, shared a childhood picture of her father, Kamal Haasan, to wish him on his birthday. "Happy birthday Bapuji (father)," she wrote. Actor Prakash Raj also shared a post on Kamal's birthday. "Thank you for always inspiring us...wish you the best on your day...our dearest Kamal Haasan," he wrote.

383.title: AAP and BJP are same team: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar
383.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar criticised AAP, BJP and claimed that both are the same team, with one following the other. "When [PM] Modi and Kejriwal have the same dreams, what is the ideological difference between them? Amidst the politics of hate...and polarisation, you want to do your politics by remaining [silent]," said Kumar.

384.title: Cong doesn’t care for country’s security, people’s sentiments: UP CM
384.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said Congress couldn’t have taken steps such as surgical strike, construction of Ram temple or abrogation of Article 370 because it doesn’t care for country’s security or people's sentiments. "Congress is a party of a family...What’s the point in voting for such party?" CM Yogi said while addressing a public meeting in Himachal Pradesh.

385.title: Mumbai local trains delayed on suburban line due to technical snag
385.article_body: Trains on the Western Railway's suburban section are reportedly running late by at least 15-20 minutes. The delay is due to signal failure reported between Vaitarna and Virar on UP fast line earlier this morning. However, the issue was resolved by 6.20 am, according to officials. Meanwhile, some passengers claimed that few locals have been cancelled on the suburban section.

386.title: UP police lathi-charge women protesting over Ambedkar statue vandalism; video surfaces
386.article_body: Five women and four police personnel were injured after a clash broke out between the police and women who were protesting over the vandalism of a BR Ambedkar statue in Uttar Pradesh's Ambedkar Nagar. A purported video of the incident which shows police personnel lathi-charging women has surfaced online. The police claimed that people pelted stones at them.

387.title: Instagram facing 'fair amount of urgency' in trying to make Reels work: Head
387.article_body: Instagram is facing a 'fair amount of urgency' in trying to make Reels work, Head Adam Mosseri told Bloomberg. Instagram aims to drive more revenue through Reels with the help of creators, advertisers and a better algorithm. "I'm trying to balance that urgency with making sure we don't make any mistakes by pushing too hard or too fast," Mosseri said.

388.title: Twitter Co-founder points out 'tracking additions' in tweets, people correct him
388.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey called the "tracking additions" while sharing a tweet "a step backwards", adding that nothing is needed after the question mark. Soon after his tweet, several Twitter users corrected him saying that it has been like this for months, with one tweeting, "Not a new addition." Dorsey later tweeted "apologies" to a Twitter user who corrected him.

389.title: Suspected drunk girls punch and kick another girl in MP's Indore; video viral
389.article_body: A video has gone viral on the internet that shows four girls, who are suspected to be drunk, punching and kicking another girl on a busy road in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. In the video, the accused were seen pulling the woman's hair and beating her as bystanders watched. The victim told the police that she was beaten without any reason.

390.title: Demonetisation was colossal failure which crippled Indian economy: KTR
390.article_body: Demonetisation was a colossal failure which crippled the growing Indian economy, Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao said on Monday. "This half-baked idea led to eight consecutive quarters of slowdown, subsequently landing in lockdown in 2020 serving a body blow to vibrant economy," KTR tweeted. Meanwhile, Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said the Prime Minister is yet to acknowledge this "epic failure".

391.title: Auto driver smashes head of man who cut off his tongue in Bengaluru
391.article_body: An auto driver allegedly killed a 38-year-old man by smashing his head with a stone in Bengaluru. According to police, the deceased had hired the accused's auto last year. He and his friends later had an altercation with the accused, following which they cut off his tongue. The accused wanted to take revenge and therefore, he killed him.

392.title: 2 male cheetahs flown from Namibia kill their 1st prey on Indian soil
392.article_body: Two male cheetah siblings, who were flown from Namibia along with six other cheetahs, killed their first prey on Indian soil within 24 hours of their release from quarantine at Kuno National Park. The cheetahs hunted down a cheetal (spotted deer), according to forest department officials. "Cheetahs making their first kill within 24 hours is beyond expectation," an official said.

393.title: What's the point of run-a-ball 30 if you can't finish?: Afridi on Babar
393.article_body: Talking about Babar Azam, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "Babar needs to listen to suggestions...He should...[bat at] number three...His batting position isn't set in stone." "What's the point of scoring a run-a-ball 30...if you can't finish the game having used up that many deliveries?" added Afridi. Babar scored 25(33) in Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh.

394.title: India wasn’t recognised during Cong’s rule, PM took it forward: Nadda
394.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Monday said India wasn’t recognised in the world during the Congress’ rule but PM Narendra Modi has put India on the world map and taken it forward in the last eight years. While addressing a public meeting in Himachal Pradesh’s Rampur, Nadda said, "India is no more a taker, it has become a giver."

395.title: 2 die while cleaning sewage chamber in Pune
395.article_body: Pune Rural Police said two sanitation workers died of suspected suffocation while cleaning a sewage chamber. One worker slipped and fell into the sewage chamber while inserting the suction pipe, while the other fainted and fell while trying to rescue him, an inspector said. A case is being registered against a company contracted for sewage cleaning work.

396.title: Manish Sisodia's aide Dinesh Arora to be govt's witness in Delhi liquor policy case
396.article_body: Dinesh Arora, aide of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, will become government's witness in the Delhi liquor policy case. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Monday moved a plea in a Delhi Court to make Arora a witness in the case. The court had granted him anticipatory bail after CBI didn't oppose the bail plea in the case.

397.title: What did the dissenting judges say as SC upheld 10% EWS quota in a 3:2 verdict?
397.article_body: CJI UU Lalit and Justice S Ravindra Bhat on Monday held that 10% EWS quota was "unconstitutional" as the other three justices upheld its validity. Justice Bhat said, "By excluding the poor among SC/ST/OBC from economically backward classes, the amendment practices constitutionally prohibited forms of discrimination." He added that this amendment undermined the fabric of social justice.

398.title: Devegowda urges PM to erect Kempegowda's bronze statue at Parliament
398.article_body: Former PM HD Devegowda has urged Prime Minister Modi to erect a bronze statue of Kempegowda on the premises of the Parliament building in Delhi. In a letter to the PM, he said, "Kempegowda established...Bangalore in the 16th century and the seeds that he sowed centuries ago have today flowered into a globally renowned metropolis that we are...proud of."

399.title: Man booked in Ludhiana for distributing sweets over Sudhir Suri’s death
399.article_body: A case was registered in Punjab's Ludhiana against a man who allegedly distributed sweets over the death of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, officials said. Suri was shot dead in Amritsar on Friday. Police lodged an FIR against the man after a purported video of him distributing sweets over Suri’s death was shared on social media.

400.title: Which companies have paused their ads on Twitter after Musk's takeover?
400.article_body: Following Elon Musk’s takeover of Twitter and the subsequent changes at the firm, several companies paused their ads on the platform. These companies include General Motors, Audi, Volkswagen Group, Pfizer, Carlsberg Group, Mondelez International and General Mills, which manufactures Häagen-Dazs and Cheerios. Advertising agency Interpublic Group also advised its clients to suspend ads on Twitter.

401.title: 3 Pune areas report poor air quality, city coldest in Maha at 12.7°C
401.article_body: In Pune, Shivajinagar, Hadapsar and Bhosari reported poor air quality on Sunday evening, according to System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). The India Meteorological Department said that Pune was the coldest place in Maharashtra at 12.7°C on Sunday night. SAFAR added that Pune's overall AQI is moderate and likely to remain the same till November 8.

402.title: Satyamev Jayate: Jharkhand CM after SC allows his appeal against HC order
402.article_body: Reacting to Supreme Court's decision allowing his plea challenging Jharkhand High Court's order against him in the illegal mining case, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said, "Satyamev Jayate". He shared the news on his official Twitter handle. Earlier, the Supreme Court had restrained High Court from proceeding with the PILs seeking a probe against Soren in the mining lease issue.

403.title: Added some bits in Shiva & Isha's story for Brahmastra's OTT version: Ayan
403.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said that he and music composer Pritam "refined the sound" of 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' and "added a few nips and tucks" to the film ahead of its OTT premiere. "I added some bits in Shiva and Isha's love story...subtle stuff. I believe that it will make the journey of the film a little smoother," he added.

404.title: Oppn leaders criticise demonetisation move, call it 'failure', 'jumla'
404.article_body: Ahead of the sixth anniversary of the demonetisation exercise, Opposition leaders criticised the move, calling it a "failure" and "jumla". Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said, "PM is yet to acknowledge...epic failure that led to fall of economy." Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed said, "Note bandi was nothing but a jumla." Meanwhile, TRS leader KTR called the move a "colossal failure".
